alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; DuPage; Kane; Kendall; Northern Will; Southern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 7:17AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kendall, northwestern Will, southeastern Kane, southern DuPage and central Cook Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 717 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oswego, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Aurora, Joliet, Naperville, Bolingbrook, Wheaton, Downers Grove, Lombard, Romeoville, Plainfield, Woodridge, Oswego, Glen Ellyn, Lockport, Homer Glen, Yorkville, Hinsdale, Lemont, Burr Ridge, Oak Brook and Westmont. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 256 and 276. I-88 between mile markers 123 and 137. I-355 between mile markers 6 and 26. This includes... Argonne National Laboratory, Benedictine University, College of DuPage, Lewis University, and Morton Arboretum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Cook; DuPage; Kane; Kendall; Northern Will; Southern Cook
